A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The good:

-Amazing effects. When  rebel cruise when light speed against the destroyer. Totally amazing 
-Really detailed scenarios.  Cantonica was really good planned. 
-

The bad: 
-Forcing "funny moments". I didn't want to see Luke taking the dirt out of his shoulder... he is a Jedi...
- Rey never got really trained by Luke. Waste of time on that island. "The training" was superficial. 
- Luke was talking about the force being light and dark together but never really got into it... so much to say but didn't delivered. 
-Superman 

The worst:
- No explanation whatsoever on knights of the ren. Even though was showed on vision on the force awakens.
-Huge plot holes.what happened after Kylo and Rey were fighting for the light saber? How she managed to leave the failing ship on time? 
-no rank of "power". Snoke\, a highly skilled sith that looks to have amazing control with the force was killed in the worst possible way by kylo. 
-Failed on delivering background story.  Snoke. Killed without explaining his master plan\, his origin or even how he started to influenced Kylo when he was a child.
- destruction of Luke skywalker purpose. Didn't train Rey\, didn't show his true power as master Jedi\, and become one with the force after "fight" with Kylo.
- no substance on relevant story. Snoke\, knights of the ren\, origin of relation between Snoke and kylo\, true power and wisdom of Luke skywalker.


In a few words\, expanded universe Luke would kick  Rey \,Kylo\, snoke plus red guards taking a sh...
